intro: Oreocallis davisiae, commonly known as the Davis's oreocallis, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its compact, tufted growth habit. The plant produces showy, violet-blue flowers with a distinctive, spurred petal structure. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
